result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryan Edward DeVore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:03 PM Defendant Bryan Edward DeVore appeared by phone.  Other Department of Corrections - Agent Cassandra Abney appeared by video. 
BY THE COURT:  Warrant previously ordered is quashed.

Agent Abney states all restitution has been paid in full on this case.

BY THE COURT:  Court will convert the balance of the costs due to a civil judgment.  Agent to resubmit the order.
Probation review hearing on May 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:59 PM Defendant Bryan Edward DeVore not in court.  Other Department of Corrections - Cassandra Abney appeared by video. 
NOT ON THE RECORD:  Agent Abney states defendant was reminded last week of today's hearing.  Restitution has been paid off.  Defendant recently was arrested for OWI but was otherwise doing well.

ON THE RECORD:  Court notes conversation with agent prior to going on the record.
BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue.  Stayed until Friday.  If he contacts prior to that, Court will hear the matter.

**Clerk to prepare the warrant if no appearance prior to Friday.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
01:44 PM Defendant Bryan Edward DeVore appeared by phone means. Prosecuting Atty Brian J. Juech appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Agent Darianne Thomas also appears by video.
Court questions defendant on failure to pay court obligations.   Defendant makes statement.  
BY THE COURT:  Court finds defendant has not made a good faith effort on this case and will extend probation for a period of 1 year.  If defendant writes letter on how much he owes on all cases and completes a financial literacy class on budgets, Court will look at converting to a civil judgment.  If paid early, probation may be terminated early.
Probation review hearing on April 20, 2021 at 01:30 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bryan Edward DeVore in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Defendant Bryan Edward DeVore in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF73, 14CF100 & 15CM44 tracking together:
Atty Hendee moves to amend Ct. 1 in 14CF73 to Burglary of a Building or Dwelling.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to the amended Ct. 1 in 14CF73, Counts 1 & 2 in 14CF100 and Ct. 1 in 15CM44.  Atty Hendee states that the parties will not be requesting a PSI.
Counts 3, 4, 5 & 6 in 14CF100 to be dismissed and read-in.
Atty Lawton agrees and enters a No Contest plea.  Defendant agrees.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.
Atty Hendee relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of amended Ct. 1 in 14CF73, Counts 1 & 2 in 14CF100 and Ct. 1 in 15CM44.  
Counts 3, 4, 5 & 6 in 14CF100 to be dismissed and read-in.

Atty Lawton states that the defendant is not requesting a PSI.  Defendant agrees.
  State has complied with victim notification requirements.  Atty Hendee gives a victim impact statement to the both counsel and the court for 14CF100 and 15CM44.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Lawton makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.


BY THE COURT:  14CF73 - amended Ct. 1:  Withhold Sentence; 36 months Probation with conditions; concurrent to each other
*Defendant is to have full time employment or provide work searches as required by the Agent
*Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
*DNA Sample + $250 Surcharge
*Court Costs = $268 
*40 hours community service
*Restitution = $962.50; joint and several as stated in the supplement
*Defendant is to establish a payment plan with the Agent for Restitution

14CF100 - Counts 1 & 2:  Withhold Sentence; 36 months Probation with conditions; concurrent to each other
*Court orders 6 months in the Marquette County Jail w/huber
Report forthwith
*May transfer to Adams County
*Defendant is to have full time employment or provide work searches as required by the Agent
*Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
*DNA Sample + $250 Surcharge
*Court Costs = $268 
*40 hours community service
*Restitution = $21,043.24; joint & several as stated in the supplement
*Defendant is to establish a payment plan with the Agent for Restitution
Credit = 0
Counts 3, 4, 5 & 6 in 14CF100 to be dismissed and read-in.

15CM44 - Ct. 1:  Withhold Sentence; 36 months Probation with conditions; concurrent to each other
*Defendant is to have full time employment or provide work searches as required by the Agent
*Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
*DNA Sample + $250 Surcharge
*Court Costs = $243.00 on the Misd. charge
*40 hours community service
*Restitution = $1,916.14
*Defendant is to establish a payment plan with the Agent for Restitution

Defendant Bryan Edward DeVore in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Defendant Bryan Edward DeVore in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
**15CM44, 14CF73 & 14CF100 tracking together.
15CM44:
Atty Hendee states that the defendant is in Adams County Jail.
  Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set along with booking.    Atty Lawton states that the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  
  Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.  

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*Appear for booking today

Atty Lawton asks that this be set for Plea/Sentencing along with the felony matters.

BY THE COURT:  Set all 3 cases for Plea/Sentencing.
Court enters a Not Guilty plea on 15CM44.
bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 10:30 am.
COPY OF LETTER D.A. SENT DEFENDANT WITH SUMMONS
